## Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

## Running Code

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

```{r}
library(ggplot2)
```

You can add options to executable code like this

```{r}
#| echo: false
2 * 2
```

The `echo: false` option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).

```{r}

datos <- read.table("./Unidad II/yeast.data",header = F)[,-1]
```

```{r}
min.max.mean <- function(X) apply(X,2,function(x) (x-mean(x))/(max(x)-min(x)))
min.max.median <- function(X) apply(X,2,function(x) (x-median(x))/(max(x)-min(x)))
min.max <- function(X) apply(X,2,function(x) (x-min(x))/(max(x)-min(x)))
zscore <- function(X) apply(X,2,function(x) (x-mean(x))/sd(x))
l2 <- function(X) apply(X,2,function(x) x/sqrt(sum(x^2)))

datos.mean <- cbind(min.max.mean(datos[,-ncol(datos)]),datos[,ncol(datos)])

datos.median <- cbind(min.max.median(datos[,-ncol(datos)]),datos[,ncol(datos)])

datos.minmax <- cbind(min.max(datos[,-ncol(datos)]),datos[,ncol(datos)])

datos.zscore <- cbind(zscore(datos[,-ncol(datos)]),datos[,ncol(datos)])

datos.l2 <- cbind(l2(datos[,-ncol(datos)]),datos[,ncol(datos)])


```

```{r}
datos <- as.data.frame(datos)
datos$V10 <- as.factor(datos$V10)
p1 <- ggplot(datos,aes(y=V2,color=V10))+geom_boxplot()
p1 <- ggplot(,aes(y=V2,color=V10))+geom_boxplot()
p1 <- ggplot(datos,aes(y=V2,color=V10))+geom_boxplot()
p1 <- ggplot(datos,aes(y=V2,color=V10))+geom_boxplot()
p1 <- ggplot(datos,aes(y=V2,color=V10))+geom_boxplot()

```
